name: Southern Pineapple Casserole
author: bex
summary: My grandmother used to make this for us on Easter. She recently revived the dish and I begged her for the recipe. It is now a staple to all my cookouts and is always a favorite. She hates that my extended family calls this "my" recipe since it's hers, but I always give her credit!
ingredients: ½ cup white sugar, or to taste
40  buttery round crackers (such as Ritz®), crushed
½ cup butter, melted, or to taste
directions: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Drain pineapple chunks, reserving 1/4 cup of the juice
Transfer both chunks and juice into a large bowl
Add flour, sugar, Cheddar cheese, and drained, crushed pineapple; mix to combine
Mix cracker crumbs and melted butter in a small bowl; sprinkle over pineapple mixture
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 30 minutes
